plot: A guy dies in Paddy's pub. Dennis and Mac use the guy's death as an excuse to get close to the guy's attractive granddaughter. Meanwhile, Charlie discovers that Dennis and Dee's grandfather was a Nazi.

While working on an average day, the gang finds a dead guy in the bar. And when the grand-daughter comes, Dennis and Mac use her grandpas death as an excuse to go out with her, which ends up in a feud between the both of them. At the same time Dee and Charlie visit Dennis and Dee's 'Pop-pop' and while there, discover that he is an ex-Nazi.—James Hake
